channel.title: Project Julia ~ The server for beginners. [Beta version in progress]
channel.description:
[center][b][size=18pt]Julia[/size][/b][/center]
[spoiler=About] I like writing tools and other interface stuff, though I'm not the best at it. With free time on my hands I started writing some rsps related tools like I see passing by sometimes in the downloads section. So I was just thinking, what if I implemented it to an actual server.
I took some time to think about what beginners in the rsps scene usually are looking for and came to the conclusion that they mainly want to get a server up without to much work. Usually they change home, owner, spawns, shops and are happy with the server, and if they can find any they'll use tools for that so they don't have to touch to much code.
I also needed a base to build my stuff around, so I did what they all do, took the first PI that loads a bunch of shitty 600+ revision graphics and has a bunch of content already.
So I'm just writing a bunch of tools now and rework the server around them. [/spoiler]
[spoiler=Progress] [i]The progress status of a component is not limited to the interface but also includes the rework in the base to get it working decently obviously.[/i]
[b]Finished[/b] [b]Partly done[/b] [b]Started[/b] [b]Not started[/b]
[ul][li]Server base properties[/li] [li]Player managing[/li] [li]Npc spawning[/li] [li]Npc definitions[/li] [li]Npc drops[/li] [li]Item definitions[/li] [li]Global drops[/li] [li]Shops[/li] [li]Extern commands[/li] [li]Starter[/li][/ul]
[i]Unexpected unsolved issues:[/i] [s]- A bug in npc spawning: A removed spawn would sometimes not directly update to the game and keep the npc visible but not intractable.[/s] fixed [/spoiler]
[spoiler=Media] [img]http://i.imgur.com/Wiu0WB2.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/YQy3uHR.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/3aO13ha.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/62cSwnL.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/VgbLSqA.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/C4eFtiY.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/mQNFPZD.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/R257rIt.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/70gXbvA.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/f6cvHBO.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/2xKtjfE.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/eg1MDhx.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/MzNV3uw.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/ruLsGu9.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/ahWIM5m.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/rmJjIRw.png[/img] [/spoiler]
[spoiler=beta updates]
[b]Updates:[/b]
[ul][li]8 august: Npc definition editor optimized.[/li] [li]9 august: Item prizes editor modified.[/li] [li]10 august: Worked on the shop editor.[/li] [li]11 august: Fixed npc spawn search function.[/li] [li]11 august: Reworked the npc spawn editor for easier...editing.[/li] [li]11 august: Started working on a data loader (experimental).[/li] [li]11 august: Data loader can now load npc spawns, expanding now.[/li] [li]11 august: Data loader can now load all data types.[/li] [li]11 august: Cache name automatically changes when changing server name.[/li] [li]11 august: Skill multiplier property now works.[/li] [li]11 august: Server messages work.[/li] [li]11 august: System update now works.[/li] [li]11 august: Finished shops editor.[/li] [li]11 august: Dumped original shop data.[/li] [li]11 august: Made lists scrollable.[/li][/ul]
[b]Media:[/b] [img]http://i.imgur.com/vSMAA2d.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/zSEOlia.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Zp0ia4e.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/O7n6yYQ.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/6bi9pqN.png[/img]
[/spoiler]
[spoiler=Final version updates]
[ul][li]Added themes to the ui.[/li] [li]Theme updating for all frames added.[/li] [li]Can't open multiple instances of the same frame anymore, the open one will jump to the front instead.[/li] [li]Reworked starter editor.[/li] [li]Optimized list readability.[/li] [li]Optimized and documented code.[/li] [li]Optimized price editor. + Bugfix[/li][/ul]
[/spoiler]

item.title: Project Julia ~ The server for beginners. [Beta version in progress]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:545658”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=664540.msg4442490#msg4442490 date=1407248191]

Good luck on this.
What are you using to make the GUI’s and tools?

Eclipse`s windowbuilder
[/quote]
Really? I had shitty luck with that. I moved one element and it threw the entire design out the window.[/quote]
Because you’re using the default layout manager.
I use absolute layout and when I’m done I let it use spring layout since I got criticism that I shouldn’t use absolute.

Upon entering a digit in the npc id text field, the drops for the npc’s will be automatically listed. (If the npc has drops of course)
Once an npc id is entered you can add drops for it.
Clicking an existing drop from the list gives you the choice to edit or remove it.

Edit: Existing Npc dropping has been modified to work with the new system.

Edit: Direct update support.
Applying changes will directly be updated for the people online without restarting the server or anything.

Npc drops is now finished.

Update
Some commands added that can be executed for others without being logged in.

Update
Player manager has been finished.
Lists either all existing accounts or the online ones which you can all edit in real time.
Either if they are online or not, changes will be applied instantly.
Reloading is required to list new character files and update the online player count, which didn’t happen in the image below.

Update
Starter editing completed.

BugFix
There appeared to be some bugs with item definitions, those are all fixed now.

Update
The data from the original PI files has been dumped into the new system.

For further updates check the original post and not replies anymore.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Julia ~ The server for beginners. [Beta version in progress]

[spoiler=About]
I like writing tools and other interface stuff, though I’m not the best at it.
With free time on my hands I started writing some rsps related tools like I see passing by sometimes
in the downloads section.
So I was just thinking, what if I implemented it to an actual server.

I took some time to think about what beginners in the rsps scene usually are looking for and
came to the conclusion that they mainly want to get a server up without to much work.
Usually they change home, owner, spawns, shops and are happy with the server,

that loads a bunch of shitty 600+ revision graphics and has a bunch of content already.

[spoiler=Progress]
The progress status of a component is not limited to the interface but also includes the rework in the base to get it working decently obviously.

Finished
